channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report I-2023090022
item.description:
Report I-2023090022

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: BEL AIR
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL EXPRESS (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 08/21/2023 this shipment containing hidden dangerous goods was discovered during the shipment inspection process at the DHL MXP Gateway, Cargo City Sud-Edificio 236, Aeroporto Milano Malpensa, Lonate Pozzolo, Province of Verese, 21015, Italy Transportation by air has been confirmed.

item.title: Report E-2023081043
item.description:
Report E-2023081043

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: CAPITOL HGTS
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank when a vehicle drove through the coned off delivery area and struck the hose adaptor. This caused the connection between the hose adaptor and storage tank to become compromised. Approximately 40 gallons of gasoline was released. First Call Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2023080986
item.description:
Report E-2023080986

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the of poly 3.5 gallon jug of acetonitrile, sodium hydroxide (un2924) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 2 cups of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023081224
item.description:
Report X-2023081224

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: BELTSVILLE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found wet box in the damage hazmat cage. I repacked the damage hazmat in a salvage drum and submitted the required reports. DescribePack: There was internal leakage from loose cap on containers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The wet package was placed in a tub and taken to the damage hazmat cage for processing.

item.title: Report X-2023080824
item.description:
Report X-2023080824

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: WHITE MARSH
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS NOTICED WHEN UNLOADING FROM THE TRAILER. IT WAS PLACED IN A CLEAR HAZMAT BAG AND INTO A BIN TO STOP MORE SPILLING ON THE FLOOR THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT QA WER AROUND THE EDGES AND THE SMELL OF ALCOHOL EMINATING FROM IT. DescribePack: INSIDE THE BOX WAS ONE GALLON JUG OF ISOPROPANOL THAT WAS JUST ABOUT HALF EMPTY DUE TO LEAKING FROM A LOOSE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IT WAS PLACED IN A CLEAR HAZMAT BAG AND INTO A BIN TO STOP MORE SPILLING ON THE FLOOR

item.title: Report E-2023090112
item.description:
Report E-2023090112

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 5 gallon pail of adhesive (un1133) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 quart of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
